title: How to Unblock Someone on Snapchat: Complete Guide + Fixes

steps.title: Tap your profile picture.
steps.content: Tap your profile picture. This will be in the top-left corner, regardless of which tab you're on. [1] X Research source A new page will open.

steps.title: Tap the cog icon.
steps.content: Tap the cog icon. You can find this in the top-right corner. This will open the Settings .

steps.title: Scroll down and tap Blocked Users.
steps.content: Scroll down and tap Blocked Users . This will be under the Privacy Controls header, below See My Location . On some devices, you may find this option under the Account Actions header. You'll see a list of all currently blocked users .

steps.title: Tap the X next to the user.
steps.content: Tap the X next to the user. The users are listed in the order they were blocked, with the most recent at the top. When a user is unblocked, they'll be removed from this list. Note down their username if you want to add them again after unblocking.

steps.title: Tap Yes.
steps.content: Tap Yes . The user will be unblocked. To stay safe on Snapchat , make sure the person you unblock is trustworthy. Add the user again if you want them on your friend list.

steps.title: Unblocking is currently unavailable on Snapchat web.
steps.content: Unblocking is currently unavailable on Snapchat web. When you use the web version of Snapchat, you have limited access to account features, such as your blocked list. This means you can only unblock users using the mobile app for iOS or Android.

steps.title: Tap the magnifying glass icon.
steps.content: Tap the magnifying glass icon. Unblocking someone doesn't add them back to your friend list automatically. If you want to remain friends, you will need to add them again. Begin by tapping the magnifying glass icon. It's at the top-left corner of Snapchat, regardless of which tab you're on.

steps.title: Enter the person's name or username.
steps.content: Enter the person's name or username. Results should load as you type.

steps.title: Click + Add next to the user.
steps.content: Click + Add next to the user. This will send a friend request to the user. If you don't see the correct user immediately, tap View More to see the complete list of results. If the user doesn't show up in the results, you may need to wait 24 hours to add them.

steps.title: Unblocked users will revert to regular Snapchat users.
steps.content: Unblocked users will revert to regular Snapchat users. Since blocking someone removes them from your friend list, they won't have the same permissions as they did in the past unless you add them as a friend again. While the user is unblocked and not on your friend list, they will be able to see your Story if it's marked as public, find you and your profile in search results, and send first-time Snaps. Users will not receive a notification that they have been unblocked. However, there are ways for them to check if they're still blocked . You won't be able to see old messages with the unblocked user, but you'll receive new ones. Keep in mind that you must be at least 18 years old to send and receive messages from users not on your friend list. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Temporary bugs in the app.
steps.content: Temporary bugs in the app. If you immediately unblock someone, you may need to wait about 24 hours for it to register with Snapchat's servers before they appear in your search results again.

steps.title: Outdated app version.
steps.content: Outdated app version. If you're running an older version of the Snapchat app, it's likely you'll run into performance or feature issues. If your Android or iPhone doesn't update apps automatically, check for a Snapchat update in the App Store or Play Store to make sure you have the latest version installed on your device.

steps.title: Unstable connection.
steps.content: Unstable connection. When you have an unstable internet or cellular connection, you may have trouble performing basic app actions. Check your connection. If necessary, restart the Snapchat app.

steps.title: Restricted account.
steps.content: Restricted account. If you violated Snapchat's Terms of Service or if Snapchat flags your account for suspicious activity, your account may be locked from doing normal actions, such as unblocking users. In this case, you'll need to contact Snapchat to unlock your account .

steps.title: How do I view my blocked list on Snapchat?
steps.content: How do I view my blocked list on Snapchat? To view your blocked list on Snapchat, tap your profile icon in the top-left corner. Then, tap the cog (settings) icon. Scroll down and tap Blocked Users .

steps.title: Why can't I find someone I blocked?
steps.content: Why can't I find someone I blocked? When you block someone on Snapchat, their account is hidden from you. This means you can't search for their profile, access a chat with them, and more. When trying to find someone you blocked after you unblocked them, you may need to wait about 24 hours for them to appear in your search again.

steps.title: Why did someone disappear from my blocked list?
steps.content: Why did someone disappear from my blocked list? If someone disappears from your blocked list, you either unblocked them or they deleted their account.

steps.title: How do I know if someone blocked me on Snapchat?
steps.content: How do I know if someone blocked me on Snapchat? If someone has you blocked on Snapchat, you won't be able to see any recent chats with them. Also, you won't be able to find their username in your friend list or by searching.
